provisions: This bill:  non-substantively amends provisions in the following titles to introduce a standardized format:  Title 63I, Chapter 1, Part 2, Repeal Dates Requiring Committee Review by Title; and  Title 63I, Chapter 2, Part 2, Repeal Dates by Title;  amends provisions to accommodate the standardized format for codified sunset and repeal date provisions;  grants certain revisor authority to the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel to modify the format of repeal dates in enrolled legislation; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This bill deals with family leave insurance.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Business, Public Employees Insurance and Benefits
provisions: This bill:  defines family leave insurance; and  includes family leave insurance in the definition of income replacement and disability income insurance.

longTitle: This bill addresses justice court jurisdiction.
provisions: This bill:  amends the jurisdiction of the justice court; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

longTitle: This bill amends election provisions regarding a proposed constitutional amendment.
provisions: This bill:  establishes an expedited timeline for:  placing a proposed constitutional amendment on the ballot for voter consideration; and  providing and posting certain information in relation to the proposed constitutional amendment;  amends requirements and procedures relating to the ballot title, analysis, and arguments for a proposed constitutional amendment;  makes conforming changes; and  provides for repeal of the provisions of this bill.

longTitle: This bill, contingent on the passage of a constitutional amendment, extends the amount of time that the sponsors of a referendum petition have to gather signatures to qualify the referendum for the ballot.
provisions: This bill:  extends the amount of time that the sponsors of a referendum petition have to gather signatures to qualify the referendum for the ballot;  makes conforming timeline changes to accommodate the extension of the signature-gathering period;  amends provisions regarding the effective date of legislation that may be subject to a referendum; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Recognizing School Support Staff
longTitle: This resolution acknowledges the contributions of school support staff and commits to celebrating their work.
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes the contributions of school support staff;  highlights the many roles of school support staff;  emphasizes school support staff's impact on student achievement and school culture; and  encourages LEAs to celebrate and honor school support staff.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Honoring the 100th Year Anniversary of the Utah Association of Counties
longTitle: This resolution commemorates the 100th anniversary of the Utah Association of Counties, recognizing its significant contributions to effective county governance in Utah.
provisions: This resolution:  celebrates the centennial anniversary of the Utah Association of Counties;  recognizes the Utah Association of Counties as a vital resource for training, legislative representation, legal services, information, and cost savings for Utah's counties; and  commends the Utah Association of Counties for its dedication to enhancing the professionalism and performance of county officials.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Supporting Major League Baseball in Utah
longTitle: This resolution recognizes Utah as an amazing state for sports, and supports efforts to bring a Major League Baseball franchise to Utah.
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes that Utah is one of the fastest growing states and has the strongest economy in the country;  recognizes the many tourist attractions and amenities Utah has to offer;  recognizes the worldwide reputation Utah has for hosting historically successful events such as the 2002 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games;  recognizes that Utah is the ideal geographic destination for Major League Baseball expansion;  recognizes the Power District in the Fairpark neighborhood is the preferred location for a Major League ballpark;  recognizes the deep and successful history of major sports teams and events in Utah, and the strong community support for those teams and events;  recognizes the long tradition of Minor League Baseball flourishing in Utah;  notes many of the economic, cultural, and other benefits and opportunities that a Major League franchise in Utah would provide; and  expresses the strong support from the Legislature and the Governor to bring Major League Baseball to the great state of Utah.

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Urging Changes to Ada Website Accessibility
longTitle: This resolution calls on Congress to review federal public accommodation laws pertaining to website accessibility.
provisions: This resolution:  urges Congress to review the Americans with Disabilities Act and enact necessary changes to give small and other businesses reasonable time to remedy alleged violations without penalty; and  urges Congress and the Department of Justice to review federal laws and procedures and develop solutions designed to support small and other businesses.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
longTitle: This resolution honors the 80th anniversary of Ballet West's "The Nutcracker."
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
provisions: This resolution:  honors the founder of Ballet West, Willam Christensen;  recognizes Ballet West's annual performance of "The Nutcracker" as the first and original version of the ballet in the United States; and  celebrates the 80th anniversary of Ballet West's "The Nutcracker."

shortTitle: Concurrent Resolution Creating the Golden Spike State Monument
longTitle: This concurrent resolution creates the Golden Spike State Monument.
provisions: This resolution:  describes the general process for proposing the creation of the Golden Spike State Monument;  details the benefits of the proposed Golden Spike State Monument for the local communities and the state;  states that the Golden Spike State Monument shall be included in the state parks system; and  approves the creation of the Golden Spike State Monument.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Reappointing John Q. Cannon as Director of the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel
longTitle: This resolution approves the reappointment of John Q. Cannon as director of the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel.
provisions: This resolution:  approves the reappointment of John Q. Cannon as director of the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel for a six-year term.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Prohibition on Real Estate Transfer Tax
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution related to taxes and fees.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
subjectList: Resolutions, Resolutions, Rules, Utah Constitutional Amendments, Political Subdivisions (Local Issues), Property Tax, Revenue and Taxation, Real Property
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  prohibit the State, or a political subdivision of the State, from imposing or authorizing a new tax or fee on the transfer of real property.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Concerning the Success Sequence
longTitle: This resolution acknowledges the value of the Success Sequence for youth and young adults, which emphasizes education, work, and marriage before having children, and encourages the State Board of Education and local education agencies to identify areas to incorporate instruction on the Success Sequence for students in grades 6-12.
provisions: This resolution:  acknowledges the value of instructing students on the Success Sequence, which emphasizes the importance of education, work, and marriage before having children; and  encourages the State Board of Education to review the state academic standards and local education agencies to review curricular materials for students in grades 6-12 and identify areas where instruction on the Success Sequence may be incorporated.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution -- Effective Dates of Legislation
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify provisions related to the effective date of bills passed by the Legislature.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  specify that bills passed by the Legislature take effect on the 61st day after the last day of the session at which the bill passed, or on a later day specified in the bill; and  make technical changes.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Condemning Communism and Socialism
longTitle: This resolution condemns communism and socialism.
provisions: This resolution:  exalts the principles of the United States Constitution;  reaffirms the principles of the free market; and  condemns the destructive nature of socialism and communism in society.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Authorizing Pay of In-session Employees
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Legislature sets the compensation for Senate and House of Representatives in-session employees for 2024.
provisions: This resolution:  sets the compensation for Senate and House of Representatives in-session employees for the 2024 annual general session.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Promoting Opportunities for Women in Stem
longTitle: This resolution recognizes the importance of expanding science, technology, education, and math (STEM) opportunities for women.
provisions: This resolution:  highlights the underrepresentation of women in the STEM workforce; and  encourages girls and young women in the state to pursue education and careers in STEM occupations.

ownerDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - Requests for Appropriation Amendments
longTitle: This joint rules resolution addresses the referral of requests for appropriation.
actionDesc: Senate file for bills not passed
provisions: This resolution:  defines "capital development project";  requires the House or Senate chair of the Executive Appropriations Committee to refer a request for appropriation for a capital development project to the Infrastructure and General Government Appropriations Subcommittee; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Honoring Utah's Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander Cultures and Communities
longTitle: This resolution honors Utah's Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander cultures and communities.
subjectList: Department of Cultural and Community Engagement
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes the contributions of Utah's Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander communities to the prosperity of the state; and  encourages residents of the state to participate in events fostering an appreciation of Utah's Native Hawaiian and Pacific Islander communities.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Dissolving Richmond City Justice Court
longTitle: This resolution approves the dissolution of the Richmond City Justice Court.
provisions: This resolution:  approves the dissolution of the Richmond City Justice Court.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Recognizing the 50th Anniversary of the National Conference of State Legislatures
longTitle: This resolution recognizes the 50th anniversary of the National Conference of State Legislatures.
provisions: This resolution:  highlights the history and significant contributions of the National Conference of State Legislatures.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Supporting a National Hockey League Franchise in Utah
longTitle: This resolution recognizes Utah as an incredible state for sports and entertainment and supports efforts to bring a National Hockey League franchise to Utah.
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes that Utah is the fastest growing state, has the strongest economy in the United States, and is consistently ranked among the top three states to live and work in;  recognizes the plethora of year-round attractions and amenities Utah has to offer locals and visitors to the state alike;  recognizes the world-wide reputation Utah has for hosting historically successful sports and entertainment events such as the 2002 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games and the 2023 NBA All-Star Game;  recognizes that Utah is the ideal place for a National Hockey League franchise;  recognizes that there is a great hockey legacy in Utah with the history of professional ice hockey in the state dating back to 1969;  recognizes that Utah offers an abundance of amazing locations where a state-of-the-art hockey-specific arena can be constructed;  recognizes the deep and successful history of professional sports teams and events in Utah, and the strong community support for those teams and events;  recognizes the many benefits and opportunities that a National Hockey League franchise would provide to the state and its residents; and  expresses strong support from the Legislature and the Governor to bring the National Hockey League to the great state of Utah.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Expressing Friendship and Support for Taiwan
longTitle: This resolution expresses support for the continued friendship between Utah and Taiwan.
provisions: This resolution:  highlights the long-standing friendship between Utah and Taiwan;  supports a continuation of the Utah and Taiwan friendship;  supports deepening the religious, economic, educational, and cultural partnership between Utah and Taiwan; and  encourages global organizations to admit Taiwan into their membership.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Honoring the 125th Anniversary of the Division of Arts and Museums
longTitle: This resolution declares February 2024 as "Utah Division of Arts and Museums Month" in Utah.
provisions: This resolution:  recognizes the 125th anniversary of the Division of Arts and Museums;  recognizes the cultural and economic impact of the Division of Arts and Museums; and  declares February 2024 as "Utah Division of Arts and Museums Month" in Utah.

shortTitle: Joint Rules Resolution - Higher Education Operation and Maintenance Costs
longTitle: This resolution addresses the operation and maintenance costs of higher education capital development projects.
subjectList: State Facilities, Higher Education, School Finance
provisions: This resolution:  requires the Executive Appropriations Committee to:  hear a report on construction inflation and the operation and maintenance costs of certain higher education capital development projects; and  decide whether to address any operation and maintenance costs of the capital development projects; and  makes technical and conforming changes.

shortTitle: Joint Resolution Regarding Local Government Employee Compensation
longTitle: This resolution encourages counties, cities, towns, and metro townships to increase benefited employee salaries with certain savings.
subjectList: Resolutions, Local Government Employees, Public Employees Retirement, Utah Retirement Systems (URS)
provisions: This resolution:  encourages setting aside any savings from each reduction in the amortization rate and, when the total set aside money reaches a specified threshold, include the amount in the base budget as an increase to benefited employee salaries.

shortTitle: Proposal to Amend Utah Constitution - Voter Legislative Power
longTitle: This joint resolution of the Utah Legislature proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to modify provisions relating to voter powers.
provisions: This resolution proposes to amend the Utah Constitution to:  provide the scope of the people's powers to alter or reform government;  prohibit foreign individuals, entities, and governments from influencing, supporting, or opposing an initiative or a referendum;  authorize the Legislature to provide for enforcement of the prohibition by statute; and  provide the circumstances for amendment, enactment, or repeal of law passed, adopted, or rejected by the voters.

shortTitle: Senate Rules Resolution - Senate Judicial Confirmation Committee
longTitle: This resolution modifies Senate rules related to the Senate Judicial Confirmation Committee.
provisions: This resolution:  removes the requirement that the Office of Legislative Research and General Counsel provide a judicial appointee's resume to the news media; and  makes technical changes to align legislative rule with the Utah Code.

shortTitle: Senate Rules Resolution - Amendments to Senate Rules
longTitle: This resolution modifies Senate Rules.
provisions: This resolution:  updates inconsistent terminology;  removes obsolete language;  incorporates certain language from existing provisions of the Utah Code;  amends the requirements for a Senate standing committee's disposition of legislation; and  addresses remote participation in a Senate committee meeting.
